etymology.description: 人(人) (rén, "person") + 子(子) (zǐ, "child") = person carrying a child -> 爪 added to emphasize carrying -> simplified strokes -> protect
etymology.interpretation: The character represents the concept of protection by depicting a person carrying a child, emphasizing care and responsibility. The addition of 爪 further highlights the action of physically supporting or protecting.

examples.chinese: 妈妈会保你健康(媽媽會保你健康)。
风雨来临时(風雨來臨時)，家人总会保你周全(家人總會保你周全)。
examples.pinyin: Fēngyǔ láilín shí, jiārén zǒng huì bǎo nǐ zhōuquán.
examples.english: When storms come, the family will always protect you completely.
